definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: People look at a giant white tiger set up for the Daegwallyeong Snow Festival in Pyeongchang, South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 韩国平昌的冰雪节上，人们正在看着一尊虎冰雕。

sentences.english: A woman slides down an ice slide at the Harbin International Ice and Snow Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在哈尔滨国际冰雪节上，一名女子从冰雕上滑下。

sentences.english: Then he described to us the beautiful scene of snow and ice sculpture in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他给我们描述了加拿大美丽的雪景和冰雕。

sentences.english: At age 12, he stood here in Zhaolin Park and marveled at an ice replica of the Yellow Crane Tower, an ancient pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 12岁时，他曾对兆麟公园的冰雕黄鹤楼啧啧称奇。

sentences.english: I met Miles' eyes who stood frozen in the alley.
sentences.chinese: 我看见迈尔斯，他正如冰雕一般站在小巷里。

sentences.english: The trees, the bushes and the tall ferns are carved with alabaster.
sentences.chinese: 无论是乔木，灌丛还是高大的蕨树，都似玉砌冰雕。

sentences.english: Ice sculpture is a form of sculpture that uses ice as the raw material.
sentences.chinese: 冰雕是用冰作为原材料进行雕刻的一种雕塑形式。

sentences.english: The monuments, showcasing architecture from palaces to pagodas, stood for more than a month.
sentences.chinese: 这些来自宫殿及宝塔造型的冰雕建筑将展出一个多月。

sentences.english: First, there was this absolutely stunning Ice Sculpture that was shaped in the form of her and her new grooms initials.
sentences.chinese: 首先就是眩目的，以她和新郎的首字母为原形的冰雕。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
a world of ice and snow
